      • colorDistHSB

        public static boolean colorDistHSB(processing.core.PGraphics g,
                                   int baseline,
                                   int incomingPix,
                                   float hueTresh,
                                   float saturationTresh,
                                   float brightnessTresh)
        Color distance on the HSB scale. The incomingPix is compared with the baseline. The method returns true if each channel validates the condition for the given threshold.

        baseline -
        incomingPix -
        hueTresh -
        saturationTresh -
        brightnessTresh -

      • colorDistHSBAutoThresh

        public static boolean colorDistHSBAutoThresh(processing.core.PGraphics g,
                                             int baseline,
                                             int incomingPix,
                                             float threshold)
        Warning here, the threshold is the same for each channel. Often the range depends on the declaration. To change the intensity of each, try to call HSB(100, 100, 100) for even thresholding or HSB(100, 200, 50) to be less picky on the brigthness and more picky on the saturation.
        Parameters:
        g -
        baseline -
        incomingPix -
        threshold -
        Returns:

                                         PaperTouchScreen paperTouchScreen)

      • erodePoints2

        public static void erodePoints2(HashSet<Integer> validList,
                                byte[] arrayToErode,
                                byte[] buffer,
                                int skip,
                                byte invalidValue,
                                WithSize size)
        Do a simple erosion.
        Parameters:
        validList - will be updated after erosion
        arrayToErode - eroded array.
        buffer - temporary buffer, same size of the arrayToErode.
        skip - quality skip 1/skip values.
        invalidValue - value to fill the invalid states
        size - size of the arrayToErode

      • erodePoints2

                         boolean[] arrayToErode,
                         boolean[] buffer,
                         int skip,
                         WithSize size)
